meanings.definition: A permission for a student to be absent from school.
meanings.sent1: The teacher granted the student an exeat to attend a family event.
meanings.sent2: Students need an exeat from the principal to leave school early.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous student tried to forge an exeat to skip class.
meanings.sent4: Her exeat was like a golden ticket, allowing her to escape the confines of the classroom.
meanings.sent5: The exeat fluttered in the wind, symbolizing freedom from school.

meanings.definition: A document granting permission to leave a place, such as a military base or monastery.
meanings.sent1: The soldier presented his exeat to the guard before exiting the base.
meanings.sent2: The monk carried his exeat whenever he ventured outside the monastery.
meanings.sent3: The lost exeat caused a commotion at the military checkpoint.
meanings.sent4: Her exeat was a key to unlock the gates of the monastery.
meanings.sent5: The exeat was a passport to explore beyond the monastery walls.
